Participant Steve: Your post:
The sun is actually **white** when viewed from space. Our atmosphere scatters shorter wavelengths of light (like blue) more effectively, which is why the sun appears yellow from Earth.  In the vacuum of space, there's no atmosphere to do this, so we see the sun's true color. 




Participant Mona: Your response:

Steve is absolutely right!  

I've actually seen some photos taken from space, and the sun is definitely a brilliant white. It's fascinating how our atmosphere can have such a dramatic effect on what we perceive.  It makes you realize how much of our understanding of the world is filtered through our senses.
